title: [BUG] sporadic CI errors with `ResNet` based estimators
body:
I have seen multiple PR that fail due to `ResNet`, with this error message:

```
FAILED sktime/tests/test_all_estimators.py::TestAllEstimators::test_methods_have_no_side_effects[ResNetClassifier-0-ClassifierFitPredictMultivariate-predict] - ValueError: 'a' cannot be empty unless no samples are taken
FAILED sktime/tests/test_all_estimators.py::TestAllEstimators::test_persistence_via_pickle[ResNetClassifier-0-ClassifierFitPredictMultivariate-predict] - ValueError: 'a' cannot be empty unless no samples are taken
FAILED sktime/tests/test_all_estimators.py::TestAllEstimators::test_save_estimators_to_file[ResNetClassifier-0-ClassifierFitPredictMultivariate-predict] - ValueError: 'a' cannot be empty unless no samples are taken
FAILED sktime/tests/test_all_estimators.py::TestAllEstimators::test_methods_do_not_change_state[ResNetClassifier-0-ClassifierFitPredictMultivariate-predict] - ValueError: 'a' cannot be empty unless no samples are taken
```

IMPORTANT note: `ResNetClassifier` is now skipped in `tests._config`. To test the classifier in remote CI, the skip has to be removed (e.g., via a revert of https://github.com/sktime/sktime/pull/3974).
